GMy-Jm7jm73LUwp401YYzw.text: Prime spot for a good bite on the strip. Came cause I got the recommendation from a local and brought my friends along with me. They all ordered the Fiesta Nachos while I ordered the Nacho Average Burger Nachos. We were also able to use the Yelp Promo for a free Margarita, so it was a bomb combo. The nachos didn't disappoint. Good to taste and at a good value for your money. The plates were huge and it seemed like I wouldn't be able to finish them, but I did anyways.  Key tip: If you buy a Fat Tuesday from inside Planet Hollywood and then come here, they'll take your Fat Tuesday and keep it in their "Freezer." it'll turn mushy later when your done with the food. Either buy it well before you head here, buy it after, or down it quickly at the door.

86Q6WUgKtbI0LIIZBXTPMQ.text: Not sure how this place has good reviews but I did not have a good experience here. First of its so hard to find because on google it says it's inside the miracle mile shops but it's not. You can only get to it from Harmon Ave, and it's not on Las Vegas Blvd. The reason for giving it more the one star is the queso was actually really good.  That was the only good part of the visit. The first thing I noticed that threw me was a broken glass on the floor. It was there for a good while until I finally brought it to someone's attention that cleaned it up. That seemed like a huge safety issue if someone stepped on it. The main dish I got was a seafood enchilada platter which tasted like the seafood had gone bad. When I brought that to our servers attention she replied "sorry, I'll let the kitchen know". No other offer was made to replace the dish. I didn't eat any of eat but I guess that's not her problem. Maybe I chose the wrong dish at a nacho restaurant so steer clear.

v7KlfH5XjR2BoxTtK1y7dw.text: My boyfriend and I were so excited to try this place because we just landed in Vegas and it had great reviews. I am not sure how it does. Once we walked in we went to the bar where a busboy was cleaning off the bar top.. we asked kindly if the bar top was self seating and he said yes and then a few minutes later he looks at my boyfriend and goes," hey chill out! Okay?" We were so confused as to why he said that, I am a server in the restaurant business and I would never say that. We literally were just standing waiting for him to clean the counter top. Hopefully he sees some better days and attitude! But, right then and there we should of just left, the food was whatever . Filet mignon nachos has some sort of chili which I found weird . I would rather not have filet mignon in some sort of sauce! Quesadilla average! Only getting two stars because of the bartenders! They are great and very nice! But won't be coming back

b7AXw1NNz8W13Y1tPjglKw.text: This is the type of food I want when I'm in Vegas.  I always try to make an effort to come to Nacho Daddy when I'm in Vegas because it's a great restaurant with good service and yummy food for a reasonable price. It's a fun environment with constant music playing and a large dining space to accommodate larger parties. I've tried the fajitas here before and they're pretty good, somewhat sparing on the meat and heavy on the veggies.   This time, however, I decided to get the nachos. They're probably meant for sharing but I was able to kill it on my own because they were that good. The restaurant is conveniently located on Miracle Mile so if you pass by be sure to check it out. If not for the food at least do it for the Scorpion shot

Our waitress was lovely but unfortunately I don't remember her name :/ the place wasn't busy so our orders came out pretty quick. I recommend this place if you want to relax and enjoy your meal at an inexpensive rate.

Py69McQbjfU9mYZ-1cyegQ.text: We visited Nacho Daddy at about 2pm on Saturday, November 1st with just a party of two. We were seated after approximately a 15 minute wait.    So, we ordered two orders of Nachos and shared each one.  There were so many good choices, and it was difficult to choose.   This place knows how to make nachos.  I mean, wow!  There motto is "never a dry chip", and they pretty much hold to that.  They were covered and coated. YUM!  We ordered the Chicken Tinga Nacho and the Spicy Shrimp Nacho. Both of them were absolutely delicious; however, we enjoyed the Chicken Tinga just a little bit more.    I did order the Spicy Shrimp without tomato.  As they were coming out, they took them back as the server forgot to place the order with the no tomato instruction.   Although we did have a 15 minute delay in receiving them, she did catch them before they reached our table, plus the manager came over and fully comped that one entree, without ever complaining or even inquiring.   So, we felt that was a nice gesture and very kind of them to do so without asking.  With that said, I know it is difficult to keep everything out of a restaurant that has open windows on the outside; however, there were four birds flying around the restaurant the entire time that we were there.  To be honest, it was really annoying.  And you never knew, whether or not there business would fall on top of you.  Luckily, it did not.  I know that it is hard to control; however, I never really seen this as a problem in other restaurants.  So, I hope this isn't a long term problem.  Anyway, I would return again -- and likely I would expect a five star experience next time.

zLj_WBlUmWvz-rG6i-ILvg.text: If you are looking for cheap, yummy Mexican food, look no further! This place is truly a hidden gem. The food, service, & drinks were all phenomenal!! Definitely go during happy hour & order the small plates. My friend and I split 3 small plates and it was more than enough to be a meal!

SFKPrrWOC__V64eFSgpgRQ.text: Nachos are very very yummy, but the rest of the food is sadly just mediocre, at best. So if you go, just stick to the nachos.

xV_Nw4UNJrdOVOoPhsYN6Q.text: Parking was hard to find , took us about 20 minutes . Once we got inside there was a wait but we got Seated quick .. there was so much to order on the menu ( beware everything looks good ) for drinks I order a mango margarita. Omg . So good , wasn't to strong which was perfect. I was able to finish it . For appetizer we order the fiesta nachos which came with beans , tender chicken , pico de Gallo , sour cream , guacamole , basically a basic nacho but so delicious , the nachos are also huge portions , I shared with my husband so it filled us up quick . We wanted to keep eating but we also ordered entrees so we didn't want to get to full . For my entree I ordered a chicken chimichanga , nothing special but it was also delicious . The only downside of our lunch was that our waiter went on her break and we were sitting there waiting for our check and she never came to check up on us so the manager had to help us . The least she can do was let us know she was going on her break but overall I definitely recommend this place .

r1gvgjFNDEOqWjhxwtYdRQ.text: What a great nacho place to chill and grab a bite! Love the name and theme of this restaurant, you walk into a spacious place with nice ambiance. Their nachos are very unique, and decently priced. And of course, they have their famous scorpion shot with an actual scorpion inside your alcohol.  I ended up getting the Buffalo Chicken Nachos. There was a generous portion and the chicken was great! The Daddy Margarita was also very flavorful.   All in all, it was a great experience and definitely would come back! Maybe next time I'll grow a pair and actually try the scorpion shot haha

_urC5ZQ2ULIkPNRHSC8aXQ.text: Nacho Daddy was such a fun experience. As a self-proclaimed nacho enthusiast, I felt absolutely compelled to check out any establishment called "Nacho Daddy". I mean, how could a place with that name not be amazing??? I had gone on a trip to Vegas a month prior to my Nacho Daddy visit and saw one of the locations as I was on my way to the airport. I swore to myself that I would be vising this alluring nacho establishment the next time I found myself in this twinkling desert. Fast forward to this trip with my friends, and me finding myself in Vegas a good 6 hours before my friends landed. I knew we had a jam-packed schedule and decided that if Nacho Daddy were going to happen, I would need to make it a party-of-one dinner before they landed.  There was an intimidating crowd of people at the door when I walked in, and I feared that the wait might be insane. Luckily for me, the bar had plenty of open seating, so I plopped down to order my first drink. I mean, nachos and margaritas are like humans and oxygen; they need each other, right? Okay, maybe that's a slightly extravagant comparison, but, you get it. So I order their house margarita from the gruff, but nice bartender (oxymoron? No! He looked like he would be grumpy but was totally nice to me in a Ron Swanson way) and started to peruse the most intimidating nacho selection I have ever come upon. First of all, I'm an indecisive person. Second of all, all of their nachos were so creative and delicious sounding, I started to get panicky, afraid I'd never make up my mind and just end up drowning in margaritas! Okay that isn't such a BAD thing... Anyways, after staring at their giant list of nacho combinations, I went with the Supreme Tostada Nachos. You guys... what arrived in front of me was heaven on a plate. One of my favorite things about these nachos were that they had the both of best worlds- shredded cheese AND the delightful gooey queso. I can never decide which I like best, so having both on one plate was a dream come True.   I felt a tiny bit self conscious being a girl all alone at the bar with an enormous plate of nachos all to myself, but eff em, I'm here for the nachos. So I dove in and stuffed myself, and there was STILL a lot left. I would definitely like to return with friends so that we could order a variety of the nacho options, because there were definitely others I wanted to try. Nacho Daddy gets 5 big fat stars from me for being my own little slice of nacho heaven.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t remember the name of these, but they have ground beef on them and are amazing. This place is awesome.

kIfVwZk4td9Sc3gMyF_M-Q.text: This was the first place we stopped at when we got to Vegas. If you check in on yelp you get a free house margarita. Everyone was so nice here, food was delicious, price was great and the best part is they had a whole VEGAN PAGE IN THE MENU!!! This is a place I would frequent if I lived close by.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan menu

l6zJtdc_Ubbd-4BsnNK8TQ.text: Man! This place deserves its awesome reviews! The food was out of this world delicious!!!! I had the pork soft tacos and my husband had the flamin shrimp tacos. They light the shrimp on fire at the table which is always fun too! The portions are VERY generous. And the quality is stupendous! Also, if you like sweet drinks, the raspberry margarita is the bomb! We go to Vegas every year and I'll def be stopping here every time!!!

5miuDtgtgYt2gRDPb2w6Eg.text: Extremely mediocre food and poor AV setup.  We were super excited about this place given the 4.5 star average rating. The atmosphere of the place is a 9 out of 10. Rustic and industrial designs that made me feel at ease. We were seated within 30 minutes and quickly ordered the 4 cheese nacho plate. When it arrived we realized it was a mistake. The plate was literally dripping with cheese. Cheese overkill. Just too much. Soggy nachos are no fun. Then we noticed the huge projection screen. It's over 150" diagonal, but sadly is out of focus and the color is off. It looks no better than SD resolution. Also the HD flat panels on the wall are off. The one closest to us had no red channel at all. See Coors logo in pic. It's not red. The rest of the meal, surf and turf tacos and crispy beef tacos were lack luster, just average. The best part was the homemade crispy shells on the beef tacos. Oh, the house margarita on the rocks was excellent as well. But overall a disappointing experience given the crappy AV equipment setup, soggy nachos and mediocre tacos. You can do better Nacho Daddy. Need to up your game to attract people that know good Mexican food and want to watch a game on a good and properly calibrated display!

Other toppings besides pico de gallo were also pretty scarce and pico is not a topping I really enjoy that much, so I fairly disappointed.  The chips themselves were light and delicious.  The house margaritas are decent but not anything special.  Service was also decent.    All in all, a good but not great Mexican place.

The french press coffee is a nice touch and the breakfast burritos are pretty good. The Chilaquiles were also good and our table seemed to enjoy the large pancakes.  Overall, if you're looking for a good breakfast close to PH, this is a strong choice.

These servers deserve every dollar they make and it would be a shame for anyone to take advantage of that! Love the place it was perfect as usual!

RGR9XUqP4ApsJiZYVy0QoA.text: This place (food) is pretty good! Great atmosphere and all the waitresses were friendly to all their customers, that's a big deal to me. I was sitting at the bar, it's open seating. This place had about a 20 minute wait on a Saturday at 2pm. Got the ceviche, 5/5 rating. And the nachos 8/10 because I have had better lol... checked in with yelp so got a decent house margarita! Overall I would come back to visit next time I'm in vegas! Fyi.. parked in the free parking miracle mile shoppes. Was about a 5 minute walk to get to this place

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. About to grub

D7c2_6wjTRWEDWjsu5-FyQ.text: The yelp reviews for Nacho Daddy are 100% accurate: this place is AMAZING. I dined here during a recent trip to Las Vegas and this was the first Mexican restaurant I found on yelp that I needed to try! Service was great, our server was super friendly and gave great suggestions on food and drinks. I had a fajita taco salad which was super fresh and delicious. Margaritas were delish as well. My friend ordered the steak omelette and it was huge! Another friend ordered the Thai chicken bowl and it was amazing, just the right amount of spice and flavors. I highly recommend this place, great food and service and the decor was cool as well. Definitely a must try!

0muvJjT6zzpaxPDrXjV55A.text: Nice enough people and decent food. Nothing special once they get your order out to you correctly, but OK for a late night bite I suppose. To each their own, but this place was not for me. The margaritas were good, but everything else was mediocre including the service, food and other drinks.

sqjE9b7F6sc-Pel3SqDPxA.text: They don't even deserve one star at that. Waited over 20 mins just to be seated. Let it be known there were plenty of open seats. While waiting, I approached a bartender to ask about drink specials for taco Tuesday. They told us the drink specials. After being seated, the waitress told us there were no specials. After waiting a total of 30 mins to get the food, it was not hot and just like warm. When asked for a new order, the waitress gave us a attitude and gave us a new order. They did not apologize or even A knowledge that we were upset. As BRI g a Vegas local, I will not return here again. I wouldn't tell any of my out of state people to visit as well

NKjyOvzuF_jtkJXSKbHYCg.text: In town visiting from NC. Staying half way down the block at the Elara.  My friend and I had to wait about 5 minutes for a seat.  It did not appear to be as busy as the night before (Saturday) despite heavy foot traffic associated with evening marathon race. Couple came in after us and decided to take table closer to bar.  After finally being seated in a booth it was at least another five minutes before I got up to inquire as to whether or not  someone was assigned that station. (Meanwhile employees were walking back and forth to kitchen) and no one ever acknowledged us. Friend and I finally decided to leave and walk back to eat at one of the places inside the mall.  Nacho Daddy.....definitely not.

7ELETZVXftjaaVxr8ogRcg.text: JOVANY was amazeballs tonight...manager on duty taking our orders and was super friendly. Loved his sense of humor and how fast he got our orders. Naked and hot scorpions!! Glad we stopped in!! #gotstung

cSO-PWXD3QnDNkmFyLDzGw.text: The food is amazing and FRESH!  The drinks are outstanding and definitely not your typical margarita!  And the service could not be better!!  Chef Reuben came to our table and made up a special sauce for us for our wings..  definitely a must!!

metwpudvHHw1sUZxxo3GoA.text: The food is good, but it's usually pretty packed, and wait staff has been rude every time I've gone there. Combined with the fact that this place is on the expensive side, you're much better off going to La Comida.

nLPj4LcuIM6X_2mARM26EA.text: This restaurant was amazing! The service was great and the shell of the fajita bowl was so fresh!!

VpuAY9A9KmWnA528dlhPBA.text: Casy was an amazing server.  Her food recommendations were excellent and tasty.  We had the Fiesta Nachos, the pulled chicken was tender and well seasoned.  The all day breakfast offered ample portions.  We were able to sit outside, the atmosphere was chill- perfect for a conversation over great food & drinks.  The specials included buy one get one free tequila drinks! Military discount was also honored.

0JwpR6rHQHTAYA9Iv_QMGg.text: AMAZING! I am from out of town(La) and this place was just all around great. I got the mexi-Cobb salad! It was pretty good and tasted amazing. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place forsure!

NxZNfokCP-9qO7T_26s3sA.text: Great food! Enchilada nachos are seriously amazing. Server- Jovanny - was attentive and friendly. Our overall experience was awesome!

rqDh3tQsPGbEGXskP14sXQ.text: This place has the best nachos but also has plenty more to offer. Great wait staff and fantastic establishment. If you don't go check it out you are missing out fo sho. I would give it more stars but 5 is the most.

DwpbYHwPul2mVapGJnKx_Q.text: It started with a terrible margarita that was so sour me and my wife joked that it tasted like an old war head sour candy with out the sweet at the end. Next the appetizer came out wrong it was Mexican corn that was supposed to be off the cob but it was on which wasn't a big deal but then the food came out and it was also wrong sauce that wasn't supposed to be on our nachos was on them and the lobster and crab tacos had a wang to them that you never want to taste when eating sea food anywhere they only received two stars because or server was present and checked on us even though it was likely her that turned the orders in wrong and not the kitchen making that many mistakes. The kitchen was open air which is fine but anytime anything was served on a hot plate it created so much smoke and steam it filled up most of the dining room. There were several large tv's with music very loud and played 6 weezer music videos back to back which was terrible and when that was over a migos loop started which was even worse we will not be back

3swZAdMzyIIUy6oa9nioHQ.text: The enchilada nachos are awesome! Make sure to try half red and half green sauce...yum! :D

tj4PlSTqSSXDiPNTcRJkEQ.text: My husband and I had a awesome lunch on our last day in Vegas.  Our waitress Arieanna was absolutely amazing.  First off the temp was really warm and she immediately fixed it for us.  Then she took the time to recommend what margarita to pick.  She even went and got a sample for us (we decided on the blood orange margarita and it was fantastic).  Then we wanted to split a nacho and she was super helpful in explaining all the menu items.  We decided on the BBQ chicken nachos and the pulled pork chimichanga and let me say she was on point with her recommendations.  I highly recommend this restaurant and you will be extra lucky if Arieanna is your waitress.

VECDBSHswC4G4TfC2Xv0Ow.text: I highly recommend this place! Don't be afraid to order the beer battered lobster tacos. They are amazing! Happened to be a mis-order to my benefit!  Don't mistake me, the service was excellent. I also had the lobster and crab nachos which were divine. I suggest ordering a side of sour cream and guacamole with it. Margaritas were top notch, just like I'm used to in Texas. The atmosphere was also great with old school rock music videos playing. Since it's slightly off the strip, the prices are very reasonable compared to the quality. I will be back tomorrow for happy hour for sure. Great hidden gem!

RkyOpWCXd2S-55JlXsWbag.text: Always great service and the absolute best place for vegan mexican food.  This is a must visit place everytime we come to Vegas.  New strip location is perfect if you don't want to travel downtown.

XOUpyAZvuVgZNlZQ10a9_g.text: 1st time here, had the filet mignon nachos which were really good! The bartender Bryce offered great customer service and was very attentive. Will be back!

Mp1j_-vOcWSxDQOF3e76zA.text: Just opened! Great service and nice ambiance. Nachos are the best I've had! The buffalo and fiesta nachos were delicious

b8YSo03V84q6dXF-jErsGg.text: You'd miss this place if you blink...it's on a side street off of Fremont Street...great place, friendly staff....food was excellent, well attentive staff...we went there for breakfast and would go back at night, unfortunately we were leaving that afternoon...will definitely go back there again!

4SOTi4wLYx07xCIrR205Qg.text: Our waiter, Ryan, was so good, knowledgeable, and friendly. Great food! The fish tacos were amazing! The vegan menu was impressive! And the chicken burrito was really good.

k2Y6BmaBngUC2HRMALU9pg.text: Yummmm. Buffalo nachos are suppper good. Only had a couple "dry chips" but you need those because there so much sauce on these nachos. And my girl loved the Vegan Chimichanga

7jDsZ2NSUBznDb1J8ft8Dw.text: We came in on a Thursday afternoon with a party of 4. Wasn't too bad of a wait, about 20 minutes. We got sat at a booth and our server was very helpful. We checked in with our yelp app and everyone at the table received a free margarita.  The margaritas were standard house margaritas. They were pretty good, nothing to rave about or scoff at.  I ordered the special chicken taco, chicken enchilada and rice. The taco was insanely huge. I would go as far as calling it a burrito quite honestly. It was good chicken, the grilled onions were delicious. The chicken enchilada was tasty as well but had I known the taco was so big, I may have just ordered a couple tacos.  The rice was definitely disappointing. A bit too much tomato sauce and the rice was dry, leading me to believe it wasn't fresh.  Overall the food was fine, the drinks were fine and the service was good. Only 3 stars though because there is nothing I would recommend as being great. Basically average Mexican food.

R7ICYq_5B1F0Zkv-SUMk_A.text: Located on one of the busiest areas on the strip, right by the miracle mile shops, this place is truly one you should try!   To start off, our server was fantastic! She was so patient, friendly, and obviously knew the menu very well. She was happy to answer our questions and honor the yelp check in for a free house margarita.   The menu is quite large! There's gotta be some item for everyone. We ordered the four cheese nachos, the mexi-Cali burger, a chicken tamale, and the breakfast tacos. Everything was served hot and looked presentable. My tacos were bomb!! Their rice was a little dry and bland so you may need to throw some hot sauce on it. Their nachos are really good! Next time I'd try the spicy shrimp ones. All their portions are hugeeee and not badly priced at all! We paid about $75 for 2 margaritas, one appetizer, and three entrees. For Vegas, that's a deal.

XB1ksL5jOBucsUbe1BV7Rw.text: Bomb!! Went to Vegas last weekend, and me and my friends split the Filet Mignon and Fiesta Nachos. Also loved that you got a free margarita once you check-in on Yelp!

Nswcd0K_cIp-DuFsns5k9Q.text: Margaritas! Margaritas! This place is a great lunch spot, with many drink options which is huge plus when in Vegas !

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qzzs4duXM8aBtaWi-xx28g.text: The food and service is amazing.  3 nights in Vegas and we hit this restaurant every night. We ordered chicken nachos and the quesadillas every time.

ULdIy32MLcTb_WxsJsSLRw.text: Thanks to the yelp reviews for leading us here! Worth an extra walk just to come. Hit the spot when we were hungry and even though the service was slightly slow to start they really made up for it during our dining time.  Absolutely Gaga over the bold flavors on these nachos... not Tex mex! This San Diegan appreciated the spice and flavor and after eating the food appreciated that there is a wait for a reason. Our spicy shrimp nachos were amply stacked with jumbo shrimp. The juicy filet mignon steak nachos complimented the spicy shrimp perfectly and there was no skimping on seafood or quality steak. This is almost 4.5 stars in my opinion as the prices were not bad considering the portion, flavor and quality!

7dCFihAc-OGPsV5f0vZUmw.text: We stopped in here for a mid-afternoon beverage and appetizer. We sat at the bar and the staff was very pleasant and willing to answer all our questions. The menu had a large number of choices on nachos, fajitas and other Mexican entrees. We started with the fresh made guac and chips. We were so full after sharing this appetizer that we left with plans to come back and try the amazing fajitas that someone near us ordered. Unfortunately we got busy and never made it back. This is definitely worth a stop when you are on the Vegas strip.

Everything tasted great. Service was spot on.... staff was super friendly and knowledgeable.  We will be back!!!

cCq2Wkd2n3sV0BdagDuqcA.text: Went for dinner on a Monday evening. Wait time about an hour. Prompt reply via text when table ready. VJ96dAiEHrnXcc9veDbOOQ.text: Very good queso and chips. Got the traditional nachos and was afraid we weren't going to be able to eat it all...we did! Had the famous margaritas and they are fresh and good. Definitely recommend this place. Great atmosphere too.

14fRcxEQQS-CFm6pavItBA.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch and we absolutely loved it!! We ordered the nachos (filet mignon.. did I spell that correctly?) and we devoured them. I had the house margarita (which I got for free when I checked in). The service was great and the atmosphere was cool!  When I'm in Vegas I will make sure I come back here for my nacho and margarita fix. You can't go wrong at this place..

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jb6CkF1bCdkds2bX3zPrmw.text: So happy to have found this gem!! This place was recommended by my daughter. The nachos are huge! We probably will share next time. I ordered the breaded guacamole street tacos. They had so much flavor and were nice and crispy. Our server was very sweet and gladly honored the free marg my husband used from Yelp. We loved the spicy salsa and hot chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-i7cF0QVsOuh24OIfEq_Vg.text: Check in here via yelp and get a free margarita with a purchase of an entree. Big portions great value for what you pay for. Got a big margarita too. They had a vegetarian option too if need be. Found out you can park in the miracle mile/planet Hollywood for free. Another bonus there. The service was great very attentive. They serve legit tacos and nachos which is what I had. It was delicious.

xqyNIW5ZLPQcEBf_d7I2Eg.text: Went to eat at this place around 9am in the morning and were seated right away. The hostess/server was very friendly and the food came out relatively fast! There are many varieties of nachos and selections on their menu. I decided to try the Lobster Crab Nachos. The portion size is definitely shareable. Although a little pricey (27$ish without tip), the food did came out fresh and you can tell it wasn't laying out on the counter for a long period of time before it was brought over to your table.   The chips were super fresh and the flavors on this dish were great. I was impressed with the ingredients they've mixed in with the lobster and crab to make it savory, citrusy, while not having the crab/lobster overwhelm the dish. Everything was well balanced!  This location is not inside the Planet Hollywood Hotel but is located outside. I walked in circles inside the hotel building trying to look for this place until I realized it was outside haha.   The only reason I gave it a 4/5 stars is because I noticed dust mites were falling from the ceiling into our water cup. When I looked up, I noticed a lot of clumped up dust/particles that would fall from time to time. I thought of moving seats but it was like that everywhere. They're in desperate need to dusting. Oh well, the nachos were still really good.

eXgpSmRVU67WCSfoG9dSCw.text: Not gonna lie, totally went back to the hotel and took a nap because the food coma hit hard after I attacked a plate of nachos all by myself. I went for the Golden Knights Nachos since it had everything and it was nice that a portion of the proceeds for the dish was going to a good cause.  Like I said, giant $18 plate of nachos all to myself. These nachos are fully loaded and stacked. Every chip is covered with either toppings, melted cheese, and queso. A fork is definitely needed to make sure you pick up everything and leave no food behind. Especially that filet mignon. Tender and delicious... all nachos should have filet mignon for me at this point. Lastly, that yellow queso is liquid gold.   Looks pretty busy on the weekend. I went here at 2 pm and there was a wait if you wanted a table. I sat at the bar, but even then, it was pretty crowded as seats were limited.   They have a pretty big menu so it's going to be easy to want to order other things, but don't forget the nachos!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Knights Nacho

Bz7sHOvfofDPy1ZOAs42Kw.text: First day in Vegas and this was the first place we yelped. It was happy hour and I got a free margarita for checking in !! I got the tacos and mexican corn from the happy hour menu and I got so full off that. The portions are ginormous so I'd recommend sharing the nachos unless you can eat a lot, its definitely shareable. Service was a little iffy but I didn't expect too much. Satisfied with my experience.

9bvsMbbeYTHnGrQotb5CXQ.text: Quick bite while waiting for my mom to get ready for the day. I ordered a chicken quesadilla with side of chicken wings. Both items were tasty. Definitely enough food to feed both me and my mother. I will definitely be back for to try other items next time in Vegas. Drinks during their happy hour were decent as well. Well made and decent prices.

kb0JJXusNa7vLy12bKYZpQ.text: Visited here for the first time for breakfast/brunch on a holiday weekend. The service was great, the food was awesome, the house margaritas were perfect. Nice selection of food for a crowd that wants savory breakfast. They also had French toast for the people in our party who wanted a more traditional American breakfast.   I ordered chilaquiles, they were great, very hearty. If you like eggs I would recommend ordering an extra egg because I felt like I ran out at the end. But all in all, great place, definitely returning! Everyone enjoyed breakfast!

lejXQXEqForCwIT0jTFrPw.text: Their vegan food is delicious, the drinks are also very tasty. I had a vegan chimichanga. Every time I come to Vegas I make sure I stop by to grab some food.

f81yUADCW69eEV5l4_Nd8w.text: Was looking around for something to eat and this come up on yelp you must try it it's amazing  we got the beer flight and daddy's margarita with the  tinga chicken nachos thank you Ari for all the recommendations she was amazing  will be back when we're back in town

hR_BLRnYi8RGZ6MAEqG70Q.text: This is our second time here. The first time the owner gave us a tour of the kitchen and freezers and told us all about how many tortilla chips he makes a day, it was awesome!  So we came back again! We had the  burger nachos  and tostada nachos and the dip trio. That queso is the best we've ever had and we are from the southwest! Our waitress Brooke was amazing and knew all about the beers and all the different nachos. If you're near nacho daddy I highly recommend hitting it up. Also, we came on Saturday night - party of 6 and they fit us in in under 25 min!! Amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tostada nachos &amp; dip trio
Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside of nacho daddy

2D_vRUclSGU0sN2_PaCc5g.text: The fish taco is excellent, and the chips and salsa were very flavorful.  The service was spotty, as the waiter did not check on us much.  But I would go back for those tacos again.

-dpTyWev64xwEuOTBHuFbw.text: I was looking for a restaurant near my hotel since my friends and I weren't keen on walking a lot after our day of traveling to Vegas. Nacho Daddy had great reviews and was just across the street, so we decided to eat here.   Despite the emptiness of the restaurant, we had to wait about 20mins. I think they were short staffed that day because it also took awhile to get our nachos. But it was worth it! I got the chicken tinga nachos, and there was chicken in every bite. It was very textural too, with the soft beans and the crunchy chips. I could've easily shared this with 2 other people. I had enough leftovers for breakfast the next day.   Even though they were short staffed, every employee that passed by made sure we were doing well, and I appreciated that. I also appreciated their awesome 90s music playlist!  The atmosphere is loud, and the decor is kinda Old West, but that's Vegas.   I would love come back and dine here again. You can always order for pick up if you want to eat at your hotel. But if you dine-in, you can use the Yelp check-in offer to get a free house drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tinga nachos

Vzvmc7r0q8zbQnYrTa7dUg.text: I used to go to Vegas every February with my friends for a week of golf, gambling, food, boozing, and general debauchery. If you read my review on Twin Peaks I mention a couple of specifics. Please, go back, and read it. Some would say its my For Whom The Bell Tolls. But I digress.   The key phrase in the opening sentence is "used to." At some point I got old, and I couldn't hang for a week of defiling myself. So, its been 5 years since I last made the trip. That was until this fall when my friends guilt trip group texted me into getting the gang back together. I don't know what I was thinking...  After the second night of binge boozing I figured it was time to eat a real meal. My best friend said I have a place in mind that I think you'll like. I'm not sure I mentioned that I love nachos...I think i mentioned that on one of my dating profiles, so I get a lot of messages about nachos...which isn't as sexy as you'd think it would be. Oh yeah, ladies, still single, I know, shocking, so holler at your boy (you'd be surprised how many women have slid into my Yelp DMs).   Back to my point, you know how Jesus loves all humans no matter how monstrous they may be? That's how I love nachos. They're all my children, and I take in, forgive, and love them all equally. From the gas station fake cheese ones, to whimsical food truck creations. Give me your cold muddled masses of cheese chips for I will nurture them. That Nas, and Kelis love. Oh wait, that one didn't work out...  Pro Tip: Check in on Yelp when you get to this joint. Not sure it works for everyone, but I got a free Margarita coupon. The only thing I like more than free booze is 90's hip hop vinyl finds out in the wild, a corgi running, and a new Tarintino flick.   Sidenote: The last five or so women I've met have not seen Pulp Fiction. How fucking insane is that. They're in their 30's, so its not because of age. Cinematic malfeasance if you ask me! Although, I've never seen the Godfather, so who am i to judge. I'm taking that to the grave on GP. A man has to stand for something, right?   As soon as I saw the sign for where we were going I lit up, and thought, "this is why he's my best friend." A single tear might have come out of my eye, but that also could have been my eyes hydrating themselves since I hadn't taken out my contacts in two days. Thanks booze.   We sat at the bar (as you always should), and the service couldn't have been better. The bartender was prompt, inviting, and overall great. I ordered a local IPA, Jameson neat, and the Filet Mignonette Nachos. I think that's their top shelf nachos cause it was the most expensive too. I tend to gravitate to the highest priced menu item. My ex used to say I live a lush life, and like the finer things, and I'm not going to argue with her (one of the only times I didn't argue with her, hence why she's my ex).   The nachos came out on a cast iron plate, and we rather large. They're enough for two people, but my friends ordered their own plates, so we were washed in a bounty greater than gold. My plate had queso, guac, and all the fixings piled high. The nachos were pretty good, but then I'm easy when I have a beer, and hook. We also ordered a dip trio that was good as well. I almost enjoyed that more as I like my chips crispy, and with so much toppings some of the chips got soggy, and I had to use a fork. No biggie though.   I enjoyed Nacho Daddy, and thought the food, and service were wonderful. Aren't nachos, and booze what Vegas is all about? Well, maybe not just Vegas, cause the aforementioned do encapsulate my life. I'm a simple man, unlike the nacho's at this joint. Hey, how about ya'll franchise a joint in Seattle, so I can life a fuller life? Now that's a Eureka moment! Take it easy people, Salute!

upwW-7nAYxte53pWKZWVBw.text: Good restaurant if you're craving Americanized Mexican food. Everything was fresh and flavorful.  Didn't try the nachos but did try the guacamole and salsa, which were super great (and they refill as you need - not the guac). The lobster tacos were just okay- the lobster itself was much smaller than they should've been, so I wouldn't recommend that if you want lots of lobster or protein in your taco. Still yummy though.   The simple hardshell tacos on the menu (forget what they're called) were really good. I really recommend it. Super simple and Americanized tacos, but hits the spot.   Extra points for the great bartenders and amazing margaritas!

You can order salsa if you want... just shocked they don't give it to you. I had a margarita and it was good as well. Fun thing to do but not a must!

N8j_TPCnMOtPEtwSQoVQlQ.text: Decided to go there after a concert in Vegas Friday night. Sat at the bar (lovely bartender btw), we ordered 2 Nacho Daddy Margaritas, a queso dip and a filet mignon nachos. The margaritas even though had a good taste were wayyyy too sweet so we could barely drink half of it unfortunately. The dip had a nice taste but was way too salty (and I love salt) so we could only eat half of that also. The nachos were the bomb, probably the best nachos I've ever had. Definitely liked the place and will be back but will skip the dip and the margaritas. Overall great place for any nachos fans out there!

_0gqOfMU2-lp6QPhE7KhaQ.text: Good food, but definitely very heavy. Came here with my boyfriend for a midnight snack but did not expect the serving size of nachos to be so big. We ordered the filet mignon nachos and bottomless chips and salsa. In retrospect, we probably would have only ordered the nachos because the nachos can feed 3-4 people alone.   The nachos were great, but after a while it starts to sit heavy in your stomach and the nachos turn soggy if you don't eat them quick. Not sure if it's worth the $19.95 either.   Otherwise, the service was great and you get a free margarita if you check in on yelp.   Great place to eat drunk food after midnight on the strip!

yY2mI4MyOYDdZW6QQ09KeA.text: My husband and I ate here beginning of February. Our first time, and we loved everything!  Our server, I believe her name is Judy, was very honest and helpful with recommendations.  For example, she recommended items that were not only delicious (we ended up ordering most of them), but they weren't the most expensive items on the menu either. I found that important because there are so many servers at other restaurants whose recommendations aren't actually that tasty, but just happen to be the most expensive item. Or, all the items they recommend are really expensive, which I find they're just bs-ing for a bigger tip.   Anyway, Judy was attentive, honest about the food, friendly, and polite!  My husband and I shared the filet mignon shrimp combo fajitas (so damn good!) and despite us having a smaller cost order, our service was excellent! You know how sometimes the service kind of goes down because not much was ordered? Not the case for us that night.   I'm also a HUGE salsa lover, but not a lover of all salsas-if the salsa isn't spicy and if it's watery...no thanks! But the salsa here is the blended type (which I love because it'll stay on the chip easily and it's my watery) and each kind was tasty and spicy in its own way.   Only thing we didn't like too much- the house margaritas had too much of the mix in it. If it were just a little less, then they would've been the best house made margaritas I've had.    But we will still definitely go back for the food and try the margaritas again!

DJHH0A39-ZnUUkWq4w0Z3w.text: We're visiting from Cincinnati and our hotel is right across the street. I have been dying to try this place since we got into town but just been so busy! Finally our last night here before our show Ka, we stopped by for some margaritas and nachos! Our server was super nice! We ordered the Grilled Mexican Corn on the Cobb, Daddy's Buffalo Wings, and the Golden Knights Nachos. The nachos comes with filet mignon but we switched it to chicken. The margaritas were awesome and strong! Our wings came out the Naked wings instead of the breaded and our server apologized- which was no big deal since we were planning to put in another order of wings! She was awesome for taking the Naked wings off of our tab since we didn't ordered it but honestly if that mistake didn't happened we would've never tried the Naked wings and we all agreed the Naked wings was so much better than the breaded! It was so flavorful! Everything was delicious! Loved the music as well! So sad we didn't try this sooner! We will definitely come back here next time we're in town!

V7dmX9Jg2d4WN0dvBKv9AA.text: Was pretty hungry after walking all day down the Vegas strip.  Had to wait a while to get a table, but the front staff was very friendly and gave us menus to look at while waiting.  Server was very friendly and offered suggestions on what to get.  Decided to get the filet mignon nachos, taco-enchilada combo, and mojo pork tacos.  Also got two quesadillas for the kids from the kid's menu. We also got two free margaritas if it's your first time checking in to this place on yelp.  The food came out pretty quickly.  The tacos were very good and there was plenty of tender pork in the tacos.  The nachos were good, but nothing too spectacular.  I'm actually glad I got the free margarita as it was very tasty.  Total for three adults and two kids was around $60 bucks.  It's a decent price for Vegas and everyone left full and happy.

X-EMuAivazPCuvzA860xpw.text: In short, this place has super cool vibes, awesome service & ABSOLUTELY AMAZING FOOD!   Our group (7 people) initially stopped by around 12:00pm on Saturday but was told it was a 45 min wait. We dropped by again on Sunday around the same time and was seated almost immediately (but the rush came shortly after). You could call ahead and add yourself to the waitlist.   FOOD (items I tried): - Filet Mignon Nachos: Seriously the ultimate plate of nachos. SO BOMB. The meat was incredibly tender and juicy. The sauces, cheese, and guacamole just infused together SO perfectly. I could finish one plate by myself if I were SUPER hungry, but I think it would be best for sharing. - Smothered Burrito (w/ both red and green enchilada sauces): HUGE and pretty good. You could add queso (instead of enchilada sauce) for an extra $2...but I think I prefer the red enchilada sauce. It also comes with a side of chips & salsa which we didn't end up touching because of our nachos. - Daddy's Margarita (free w/ Yelp check-in): Pretty yummy & refreshing! I noticed the frozen margaritas were A LOT stronger than the iced ones. Pick your poison.  SERVICE, ETC.: Our server was Huck & he was super great, friendly, and helpful. The food took a while to come out. But when it did, we all got our orders at the same time (though some plates weren't as hot as others).   The World Cup game was on, so the super big flat-screen TVs scattered throughout the restaurant were perfect for the occasion.  It's opened pretty late so it's PERFECT for late night drunchies.  TBH, I'd choose this place over a buffet any day. A must-try if you're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon Nachos (free margarita with check-in on the side)
Photo of Nacho Daddy - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smothered Burrito with green &amp; red enchilada sauce!

aSAm-wDMyUnfujGSaUn5wg.text: Great vegan menu. Shockingly large. I got toe avocado tacos and chips and salsa. I was really happy with my meal. The tacos came with a side of rice and black beans. Everyone else loved their nachos and chicken wings. The skinny margarita was good. The wait on a Wednesday wasn't bad. Maybe waited 20m. Though if you can find seating at the bar that's easier. They played 90s music videos. We enjoyed that too. There isn't a good wine selection but I guess wine and nachos don't go together. It's not your normal average crowd. It's loud too. I would go back. They make good food.

9NHv6x8rN-19WrYvw1bgnQ.text: Came across this jewel through the yelp app. All it took was me reading the name and all of us decided we had to go the next day.   Upon arrival the restaurant had plenty of open seats. So we were surprised when we had been given a wait time of 20-25 minutes. There were only four of us. We were just as shocked when a couple was given that same wait time.   When it was time to order we had a range of goodies. I ordered the filet mignon nachos (absolute heaven). The table also had fish tacos, chicken tacos, queso, & salsa. Presentation and flavor was perfect. I have no pictures because we all tore into our food.   Our waiter, Vince I believe, was extremely nice (on the eyes too ). We will definitely visit again.

The two Nacho plates we had were bland. The refried beans- a straight from a can kind of taste. I've enjoyed "Bar Food" before. The kind served after several rounds of Adult beverages. I was enjoying a good Buzz and could have used some interesting flavors to make for a better experience. I've had tastier Nachos at 7/11.

W_es8U_hdEEYkAg5_1rOPg.text: I went in on a Sunday, was strolling around with a couple of friends on the strip and we were starving and decided to just pop in at nacho daddy. We enjoyed the food and the drinks were tasty BUT THE SERVICE! Jasmine was amazing. She is such a sweetheart and was very attentive. Place is lucky to have her. Thanks daddy...I mean Jasmine ;)

7o94PV7F-2zlN7NhE4WArQ.text: Great nachos! My fiance and I ended up sharing nachos for lunch and we walked away happy. Don't believe I could have finished the entire plate on my own.

pwJYutXYOFIFH4PSggxfIg.text: We really enjoyed this place.  Food was good and the service was friendly.  Plus, the location was very convenient to our hotel.  We'll be back!

9NEhEUeyz9zx9TH8D6rIhQ.text: Our experience started off poorly because I was very annoyed that we had been ripped off on the street buying the tall frozen cocktails and when we arrived they said we had to leave them by the door. On the Las Vegas Strip, that is a lot of trust to put in the hands of others. The girl said we could chug them otherwise and that wasn't going to happen but it was late and we were starving. I asked if we could put them somewhere out of reach near our table and that was refused and I just feel like this is poor customer service. I was happy to buy a drink there but they clearly didn't care and it said the mood for a poor experience.   I was not overly impressed with the nachos and I was really unimpressed with the skinny margarita. We have been spoiled by having some really fantastic nachos and some delicious margaritas and these were not living up to my expectations. I've had plenty of skinny margaritas that didn't taste like club soda but this one was particularly awful. Our waitress was nice and offered to remake it for me but I just couldn't stomach the mixture with the club soda so she took it off of our bill. I drink vodka club too so this was particularly odd but it just didn't taste like a margarita!  We shared a plate of the nachos and we took advantage of the yelp check-in offer to get a free house margarita but the Nacho Daddy margarita is NOT it so don't be fooled. I guess just ask which is the house - we just paid the $3-4 upgrade fee.   Overly disappointed with the experience and hostess's customer service. I definitely think it's worth trying other options on The Strip

FP7bFNtC4HMBxVxyt9lp5Q.text: This place has a "catchy" name, but at least the food isn't lame. The place has ridiculously high ceilings which makes you wonder why they aren't using the square footage to its potential-hello-put in a second level. Anyway, my boyfriend got the street tacos-there were three of them and he said the meat was flavored well. I had the fajita salad which came in. Large tostada bowl. It had Mexican rice, sour cream, cheese, peppers and onions, lettuce, beans, and some tasty grilled chicken. It was more than I could eat, but I was surprised at the good flavors. This place is right off the strip. Convenient location. Oh, the house margarita is pretty good too. I was pleasantly surprised by this find. They did Mexican right!  Btw the menu was too large to take pics of and I was too hungry to take them.

xNbdtsPCr9C3p2SrbQpFKA.text: We stopped in at this newly opened restaurant pretty close to our hotel and had a great time. They have some unique menu items including spicy shrimp nachos, lobster nachos, etc. as well as some classic items such as regular nachos and tacos.  The waitstaff is friendly and eager to give you recommendations and advice on what to order. We went with the queso for an appetizer and their supreme nachos to share. Both were excellent. I had a house margarita, which was good but a little on the sweet side.  If you are feeling adventurous, they also offer a scorpion shot where you can shoot a baby scorpion in some tequila - or whatever liquor you choose. When in Vegas....you have to try something like this once...plus it makes a great photo opportunity. The scorpion will set you back about $9, on top of the shot - so not a cheap adventure, but how often do you have the opportunity to eat a scorpion?

tpWpVIU4Pts1MBvx_HjsGg.text: Easily one of the best places we ate on our trip! The nachos are HUGE and can easily be shared by two people. He buffalo nachos literally made my mouth water every bite. The unlimited chips and salsa option is a must. It's only 2.95 for up to 6 people and the hot salsa is amazing. The price is good as well. We ate during happy hour and got the mini chimichangas and I'm still dreaming about them. The mango marg is amazing too, just a little sweet. Will forever go back here when we visit Vegas.

M9dlUUDoeNz8baMafa9GIw.text: First of... AMAZING food, the drinks are wonderful, and our waitress Kimberley... is a fricking riot!  She was AWESOME.  Very attentive, so friendly, and seriously just awesome!  We HIGHLY recommend this place... and, ask to be in Kimberley's section!

3pbnafhNX3-wPILVxi7wGg.text: Was looking for Mexican for lunch and found this on Yelp, glad we went there!  Easy to find, just down Harmon beside Planet Hollywood.  Waitress was cute and friendly, great service.  We had the Cadillac Margaritas (top shelf) and they were great!  Also checked in on Yelp for the free house margarita that was fine but a little smaller.  For appetizer we had the chips and guacamole, the guac tasted store bought rather than fresh so one star down.  The Golden Knights nachos were off the chain though, very good and not skimpy on the toppings.  The steak was moist and not dry.  The scorpion tank inside was neat, will have to try the scorpion shot next time!

4At6ANk6vxqlbMXPh9aTQQ.text: Awesome, just awesome!! Wife and I stopped in for some late night munchies and could not have done any better. Chimichanga and chicken nachos were on point. Great service and good drinks. Love this place!

fyrDmQVNEmFBuVzPlLQ0bQ.text: Best nachos ever! Get them with chicken, it is seasoned perfect. One order is enough for two people.

5QO1pmtZ-wW0kZqTMM-PCw.text: Stop by last night after checking in at are hotel. After being treated like crap by the customer service in the hotel we decided to grab some dinner. I'm so HAPPY we went to Nacho Daddy's. The Service was amazing but the food was even better. I tried the Thai chicken nachos some of the best nachos I've ever had. My husband had the pork tacos and fillet mignon tacos both options are tasty. After having a horrible start to are vacation I can say Nacho daddy's turned are horrible day into a great night. Will definitely come back. As we left a group was going into the restaurant next door and my husband yelled your making the wrong choice and told them to try Nacho daddy's instead. DEFINITELY WORTH TRYING a new Vegas must...

_RBdW5d2VeoNw-wFQb7imQ.text: Stumbled across this place from a recommendation by a bartender. Really awesome decor - music videos playing and some great tunes coming through. Place gets three stars due to it having a decent beer flight for only $9. Ordered the VGK Nachos - man are they disappointing. Small plate with Luke warm to almost cold toppings and cheese. For a place with Nacho in their title they don't do a very good job with nachos. Also ordered wings. Only two kinds...BBQ and Buffalo. No other sauces or types available. They were decent but only 8? Really. I might go back to try something else for the beer and music but avoid their so called signature dish - it's all HYPE! UPDATE!  Was contacted via email by Taylor Smith. At first she seemed genuinely concerned with the not great experience we had. But she only said "we did get voted best wings by Insider". Who cares??!! I'm talking to you about giving me 8 wings instead of 12 and charging me for them. They're not great!  She was not concerned with my experience and clearly is a HR/Mgmt flunkie charged with responding to reviews. She doesn't care what you say...the customer is always WRONG. Anyway, you should not order the nachos or the wings and tell the manager to stick it!

CUA-ojESX4HtGAbm3BzZ1A.text: The food and service here are absolutely exceptional! I ordered the mojo pork street taco plate and my friends ordered nachos and we devoured our food-no leftovers whatsoever! Their wings are also amazing, but I think that their nachos and tacos are top-notch, the BEST!

8K8sp_7XAcuqs2pFUR26xg.text: Nacho Daddy, is your quintessential Vegas experience when you walk in. Tarantulas (correction actually Scorpions), 90s hip-hop music videos, lots of skull decor, and drunk people. Get beyond Ed Hardy facade and Nacho Daddy actually has a beautiful soul.  Yes they have Nachos, but there are many cheesy mexi options for your face. Everything from Spicy shrimp nachos to vegan quesadillas.  The portions would make Guy Feiri blush. Any place that can hold down a respectable greasy and delicious bar menu and still do a good job of creating delicious vegan/vegetarian/gluten free options deserves respect. But here is the kicker for every meal sold, they help feed less fortunate people in Vegas. Their slogan is "Never a dry chip." Let me ad "Or a dry eye." Keep doing the good work Nacho Daddy!

HmAZInK64lbGkk65VTBGCg.text: Found this spot on our Vegas trip, food was very good and the vibes are cool! You get a lot for what you pay for. Favorite restaurant in Vegas so far

ampCk5JV9Dkdgj_SehQWEA.text: Great food. Great service. Large servings. Not just Nacho's. The fish tacos where out of this world good and the queso was amazing!

ZBJAwX6g1kCQSljBEcEe4Q.text: AMAZING. I feel like that's all there is to say about this place. It was SO good. Granted, nacho's just happen to be my favorite food and I've never been anywhere like this.  I didn't even bother looking past the nacho section of the menu because they had so many cool options to choose from. The only thing that turned me off a little bit was the price, UNTIL I actually got my food and realized that for the quality and quantity it's totally worth it! I had no idea my nachos would be stacked so high. Pictures just don't do them justice. It's most definitely worth a stop, especially if you're a nacho fanatic like I am. You won't regret it.   There's some appetizer trio with salsa, guacamole, and queso that they light a little fire under to keep it all warm and melty. Oh my goodness. Quite possibly the best queso I've had. I would most definitely recommend it. Also, the white peach margarita is wonderful!   Definitely wishing this was a chain in Texas, but then again I doubt it would be this good if it was.

Auqb6vOWBHERsOETpSgTPQ.text: Came here after seeing almost 2k of 4+ star rating. I'm not sure how.  None of the five different dishes were any good. The server was good but that's about it. Very suspicious of the reviews of this place. Seems that Yelp is no longer trustworthy

znV_BBtn81BE3WWlVoRRmw.text: It's a go-to place to visit and eat anytime you come to Vegas. I never leave Vegas without coming to nacho daddy. One order and it's good enough for 2-4 people. It's literally that much.  Food is always 100% hot coming to the table. I never had a bad experience with the staff. Greeted promptly. Also for a busy place the floor is always clean. They do a really good job and keeping the place very neat even with children throwing things around sometimes. I'm basic, I like getting margaritas, very well balanced each time. Love this place I always come back for more

0UWE9ieOIztAgchiqwrfUA.text: The house margaritas is worth the five stars all on its own. It also helped that you get it free with check in and it's $8 after the fact. I Nacho Average Burger Nacho whole it mostly tasted as if it was just something I could make at home the chips where amazing and the atmosphere was great. My friend and I stayed for over two hours just eating, drinking, and taking. I haven't been to Nacho Daddy since but I plan to return.

Their free margarita with a yelp check in was a nice perk. It was enough to enjoy with company and the nachos were big enough to split. Service was also fast.

We also had the Triple Dip - guac was chunky and buttery, just how I like it. Super smooth cheesy queso and spicy salsa with fantastic flavor. The smothered chicken burrito was huge. 55v41NkjBgm-zQJzp_IZtQ.text: Got turned into Natcho Daddy by a friend who returned from Vegas just as we were getting ready to fly there ourselves.  What a great tip!  Great atmosphere (lots of original MTV in the mix on the video screens for us baby boomers).  Staff is fantastic. We are here twice out of our 4 nights.  Serena was our server both times and you couldn't ask for better.  Also met Joseph the manager, who showed us some extra hospitality.  My wife and I had the Baja Seafood Combo. A fish taco with a crab and lobster enchilada.  Served with Mexican rice, re-fried beans and cherry tomato pico.   The great thing about Natcho Daddy is the price. It's on the strip, across from the Cosmopolitan and the Aria. It's next door to BW3, south of the Walgreens.  If your staying on the strip and can't afford $200 a night for dinner, this is a great alternative.  And they have a live scorpion!!!!

PC8QMPSwl406PNCzcegCXA.text: Fantastic food, and great atmosphere.  Fun place to hang out with friends and family and watch a game or so.  I'd recommend this to any friend or stranger.

e1VUlhjWkWhUbw8xfaMF0Q.text: I'm pretty sure that we will visit these folks at Nacho Daddy during our next visit. Great team there!  Fun atmosphere, kitchen staff was all over getting awesome food right away. Service staff were on top of getting us taken care of as well.

4-e717McMsaXDuPFDLOYgQ.text: I was actually surprised bu this place, and to be fair, we may have just gotten lucky, as it seems like the kind of place you a 70/30 chance of getting it at the right time/group. We did, oddly enough it was a Friday night around 8pm and the place was pretty empty. A few tables here and there but you can tell this place was really designed to be packed and loud.  Glad it wasn't.  We started with margaritas, and I got the spicy cucumber margarita.  Boy oh boy.  I do love me some cucumber water, and I like spicy things, so those elements combined with a margarita and good booze?  Heck yea.  It was just ever so slightly too sweet, but I would get it again 10/10 times.  Just a little less sugar.  This place is obviously all about the nachos.  Though they have a TON of other options, lobster tacos, enchiladas, burritos, etc.  Obviously, I went for the nachos.  But with SO many to choose from how do you pick?  I could have gone for the classic guac and sour cream, or the extravagant loaded with this and that, but instead opted for Sloppy Joe nachos!  Yea.  Who doesn't love sloppy joes???  And nachos??  Right!?  So yea, this was a cool idea, and I had to try it.  Glad I did.  The sloppy joes were good, and the chips held up under the strain of seasoned and sauced ground beef, cheese, and the like.  I would be interested to try some other combos next time.  I think what I would do next time is have everyone order different nachos and then share them family style so you can try a bunch of them.  As it is the servings are large and I could not finish mine.  So a good ratio would be one nacho order per two people I think.  Everyone else complained that their drinks were all overly sweet and some chose not to finish drinking them at all.  Too bad.  The goblets they come serve in are large and about $14 each so seems a shame.  I would have asked for something else, or it to be remade less sweet.  But just a heads up if you tend to not like sweet drinks (I don't blame you).  I tried one and it was way too sweet.  I still stand by my spicy cucumber margarita as my top choice.  The service was good, and the place was nice.   Like I said YMMV but we got there at a good time on a good night and had fun. I don't know that I'd come back, as there are so many choices around Vegas, and I think this is a chain, so I'd avoid it maybe for that reason as well.  But if a group made the choice to go here, I know I would be able to find something I liked, no question.

7Tb6cAMXRc-AqWZAkOU3PQ.text: Yes best nachos ever - but almost overkill.  I ordered the filet mignon nachos but the beef was not as tender as I expected - thus deduct one star.  We also ordered the shrimp tacos - a bit overcooked so I would skip this one as well.  Next time, I would try the chicken or ground beef nachos instead.  Free magarita on check in.

eSjxMlsYJ7N4aK0q3yGffQ.text: TBH the name drew me to this place, but after looking at all the reviews I knew I had to stop in!   First off, don't forget to check in for a FREE Signature Margarita! Can't go wrong with that, had a good amount of alcohol and was a great way to start the meal. The ambiance is perfect for groups with plenty of tv screens playing either sports or throwback hip hop songs. Now onto the food:   Filet Mignon Nachos - SO GOOD! The meat is very tender and everything about the taste was perfect. The only thing I would fix is maybe adding more chips since those ran out real quick and the portion size isn't the largest I've seen, but it's definitely quality over quantity here.   Thai Chicken Nachos - made with spinach chips, these were definitely not your average nachos. Wasn't a huge fan of these since the chicken was cut a bit larger so it was a bit harder to scoop.   Peach Margarita - got a pitcher of this and it poured 5 cups easily. Absolutely loved it and would recommend it to others.   Overall, I'd make another stop here the next time I'm in Vegas with some friends. The service was great, ambiance was chill, and paired with some delicious nachos means you're in for a good time.

bOGmVaSxwoEQCWKwrKvbUA.text: This is the best mexican food restaurant I've ever been to! The atmosphere is so fun, the service was unmatched and the food was unbelievable! We were a big group and every single dish was fantastic! They only use filet mignon in all their steak dishes which is so appreciated! I finally get guaranteed tender meat in my fajitas! I will definitely come back when I'm in LV!

DcH8bNatxXLa1HUEPEaXlg.text: This turned out to be one the best breakfasts we have had in awhile. My wife and I had run out of ideas where to go for breakfast, looking at this place online we just didn't think it seemed like it would be a great spot but I thought Mexican for breakfast sounded good and we decided to give it a go, what a great idea. The yelp check in offer for a free margarita didn't hurt neither did the military discount. So we started our day around 830 with a margarita and some Thai Nachos. We were both very happy and the fact that so much of the menu was gluten free was awesome. You could order anything on the menu day or night. I went with the Huevos Rancheros and my wife had the Chicken and Kale Scramble. We were both glutenous and very pleased with our very full bellies.

xrv5_oL6F6XqmyWvyBDdLw.text: I have to say, everything the good reviews say are True about Nacho Daddy! Friendly, fast service, delicious food served hot and fresh, and a casual, fun ambience.   My order was lobster crab tacos (I subbed corn tortillas for flour) and the Supreme Tostada Nachos. Whatever sauce they put on those tacos, I wish I could take a jar of it home! The seafood was well done too. And the nachos were pretty darn tasty. Their homemade tortilla chips are perfect and the queso they use, yummmm! The Asst. GM stopped by my table to make sure everything was good, which always makes me smile   Although the location is slightest off the strip, it's easy to find. Just look for Buffalo Wild Wings next door. My advice to anyone considering visiting the Taco Bell Cantina (just a few doors down) is to swing the extra cost and step outside of the fast food box - and check this place out!!

UsZZK-iih-XxoSgzyNlk0Q.text: The food is tasty! Try the Lobster tacos, you will not be disappointed! Chicken enchilada is good as well.

IGi_Lkhxh7HsxyW6C__3PQ.text: The nachos we got were the supreme tostada nachos. They didn't blow me away and the jalapenos were too spicy and overpowered the flavor. For a place with nacho in the name I expected better. Also the service was slow and we didn't get offered refills on our water. Don't get me wrong the nachos were good, I just expected better!

jfDzl8NuqdQDqMPdrLJY6g.text: Food here was delicious - especially stoked that they had a vegan section on the menu! Had some delicious "chicken" street tacos and the chips and "queso." Husband enjoyed his pork (real pork) tacos, too. Our server (Ryan) was really attentive. Great atmosphere, too. Will be back.

mQcB5BqjwpaOeetBYdghTA.text: Great vegan food options! If I'm. Ever back in the area I'd stop by again. Try their vegan nacho plate it's the best!

dQE93I_pRrCo2VBZbxNb4g.text: Servers are always super chill. Quality is great at this location too. Try the vegan chick'n quesadilla or the vegan nachos. The way they marinate and prepare the plant-based chicken makes it very flavorful and the texture is spot on. Non vegan friends love it as well :)!

hYreyZAhw8sTDY6YUANyeg.text: The food was great and I really liked the music selection. It was my first time and I'll be back next time I visit Las Vegas.

ZvzVma_QJS-Aod_R6ttNdQ.text: Delicious bloody Mary and many yummy foods. We even went there 2x. Once for lunch and once for brunch. Chicken and kale was good and also the nachos! Definitely a good place to try.

Tn90jD6HCS9P9wxv6M-0EQ.text: Amazing places deserves the proper recognition.  Without a doubt the food and drinks are amazing.  Perhaps an under statement but I want to talk about the staff.  My husband and I visited  the establishment and had Huck as our server.  I saw another review that mentioned him...I can confirm he is excellent.  I was very impressed.    As consumers we take a chance when eating in restaurants.  We were watching a special on tv that highlighted  restaurants that was rodent infested.  I was disgusted and even more hesitant about eating out.  Then we meet Reuben and Oscar... the head Chef and assistant.  They were walking out and we stopped them to give compliments on the food.  They thanked us and what was more surprising ...invited us to tour the kitchen.  Keep in mind, I just watched the show so I really was hesitate about going. Well, the pride they take in what they do was shown in the cleanliness and organization of that kitchen and prep area.  Some faith restored...so impressed we ate there the next day and will tell everyone to visit when in Vegas.  Good job guys...continue to take pride in what you do!!!

ozZPHSOzfZQB2O4Bx0PMQg.text: I gave this establishment two stars only because I sat at the bar and one of the bartenders was good. I ordered a michelada it was made with tomato juice not Clamato. I was at the bar and saw multiple customers come in but there wasn't a hostess. So they left. After I drank my "attempt at a michelada" I was never asked if I wanted another drink. I ordered Buffalo chicken nachos, what I got was some nasty pile of stale tortilla child with sour cream and Buffalo chicken sauce that took 30 minutes to prepare. I do not recommend this place to anyone, and I'm not picky at all.

6T7Ub0nVzTqGeNC3IjKiww.text: First time trying this place. It was delicious, would definitely come again. Nachos were delicious (many options), breakfast burrito was simple yet tasty, and the wings were flavorful. Also, our server/waitress, Gabby, was terrific! Very attentive, polite, thorough, efficient service. We were celebrating a birthday, and she helped make it great.

PB21BYHGIZsiDCn_orPkdA.text: The nachos were yummy. I ordered the four cheese nacho with jalapeno. They were definitely generous with the cheese dip which I like. Portion sizes were huge. Service was good too, my friends and I didn't wait long at all for the food to come. Our waiter was nice. They have plenty of vegan options, almost a whole page on the menu. And the prices were very reasonable, it has a wide range, so it fits all budget types. Location wasn't right on the strip which was good for me cause when it's right on the strip it tends to get really busy and crowded. However, it's not far off the strip either, it's about two hundred feet away so it's in walking distance and convenient as well.

wLNg0lGpA8bHNHU1LHtQHA.text: I was sad to see Nacho Daddy close at Henderson because it was around the corner from my place, but now I can stop by after work and enjoy the same delicious filet mignon nachos... Not to mention their margaritas.... Love them!  The staff is always wonderful here, specially if you tell them you use to go to the Henderson location. See you there every Friday!

UMOnFlD6KmNPaZd4mv1h8A.text: As a vegan in Vegas, my options were sooooo limited.   A restaurant on the Strip with multiple vegan-friendly dishes came as a total surprise.  My friends and I walked here after a pool party and wanted something fulfilling and sobering.   We had the coolest server ever. So chill and laid back, yet attentive and professional. He reassured me the vegan Chik'n nachos were so good, I would seriously think I was eating meat.   He was SO right. Even a guy friend of mine who is a devout meat eater had to admit he enjoyed it. This review is actually 5 months later, because I'm back in Texas and I can't get my mind off of these bombbbb nachos. LOL

sNQvI6zRe7rgNrsugcPxcw.text: WOW!!!! Great food and we had the best server. We sat and it seemed like they forgot about us when Rachel walked and said she had seen us sitting for a few minutes and if no one had taken our order yet she could get us started. She was so amazing that we asked to be our server. She took great care of us, probably one of the best servers that I've encountered eating out. Thank you for making our night by being such a delight. When I go back here I will only ask for her to take care of us.

97_b5JzT4trjTErZrxfB4g.text: More like yes daddy! Love the burritos ! And such great vibes ! Can't wait to go again!

y4OhFhaRgJrVYbyu8f-XwQ.text: We had great service and I loved the food. Especially the ceviche!

M64J7pldXe4C68dhMVUR9Q.text: These were the best nachos I've ever had! I swear they were made fresh to order and the spice was on point. We went here based on the name because it made us laugh. We definitely chose smartly because the food was great and the drinks were even better! I had the lobster crab nachos. People say share them, but I finished them all myself! muahahaha

ngRAa11mBA0cNkZJZ0LDTQ.text: This place was a really laid back atmosphere and friendly staff.  The margarita I ordered free from checkin I upgraded to larger for $2.  Really tasty. Ordered the filet fajitas and it was awesome. Great flavor and portion.  Recommend a visit here.  Comprehensive menu so not just nachos.

k8gi8OvXx4Wf50x3DY10Xw.text: Litzs was amazing ! Our first time in town from MN , she was extremely accommodating to our order-making changes and such! Super friendly ! Def would recommend to come out here, amazing portions, music and service !

kv9zY0QnwPNw586c66luQw.text: Nancy was the best waitress! From the authentic Mexican food to the scorpion shot this place is a hands down must eatery!

Ycxn5FHWZcuPlrpJ_stUOg.text: I was visiting the area and met a local friend here for lunch. It was easy to find, a short walk from any hotel in the heart of the strip. The service was excellent and the food was equally as good. I am a nacho lover and was very impressed with the variety of flavors available. The portions were huge, plenty to share. My only complaint, is that there is not a Nacho Daddy where I live in East Tennessee. I will definitely look forward to eating here on my next trip to Vegas.

OQgwxIkmL23ch5Dm5R3TYw.text: I love this place! *open late *full menu offered late  *vegan menu!   I found this place after we watch the amazing jlo show and Las Vegas we were craving Mexican food as a vegan I thought my options would be limited. But boy was I wrong.  We arrived here around midnight we got seated right away I checked in to Yelp and got the free Margarita a For my husband. He said it was made just right .  I ordered from the vision menu the street of avocado  tacos and the vegan nachos. The tacos were delicious the of avocado is deep fried the toppings on top are just perfect with a little hint of lemon they are delicious. My husband stole one from me and he said that those tacos were better than his Buffalo wings that he had ordered . We sure the nachos which were a pile high and full of flavor and freshness. Definitely will be coming back here when I hit Vegas again.   Shout out to Harol (the guy with the hair) great service!

ZxTZbZ-i5oYgc7f7KVMmfw.text: The staff is friendly and the portions are very generous, so plan on eating your nacho plate with friends.

pBku5wP-Mz1KHg25uibNlw.text: Picked up lunch here. Greater at the door by a pair of scorpions before seated. Great margarita and nachos. This is defiantly not my daddy's Nachos!

cKIv5Ku5pdqePCEI4_vIZw.text: I ordered some nachos that the server recommended. The steak nachos. They were $20 and not very good. I've had better at crappy pubs. Server was very slow to and no one was there. Not the best experience.

BKx4TbOUJkPU4cdJRJUVkA.text: Shout out to Vince. Awesome service. Will definitely come back. the chilaquiles and sloppy joe nachos are a must!

XAfrWNfgUghIXHKeb94v5w.text: We really enjoyed this place.  The filet mignon and chicken rings nachos are delicious!  The service was just right.  We will come back  here again.

yXJL7E99IXJB5sauQxa7vA.text: Kimberly is the best!!!!  We checked in and got free house margs and on top of that the Fiesta Nachos are to die for.   LOVE THIS PLACE

QFizdO_barN0U1QE6Evaow.text: Thought this place was excellent!  I can't believe it wasn't busier because the food and service were both terrific.  I guess it's because they are about 100 yards off the strip; sort of at the corner of Harmon and Las Vegas Blvd by Buffalo Wild Wings.  We had a hard time finding it because the signs at the Miracle Mile shop showed it right by the Paris hotel but that is not correct.  The skinny margaritas we had were $12 each but very large and tasty.  The shrimp fajitas for two was huge and yummy.  The naked wings were also good and my 'Daddy Bowl' with quinoa and chicken was superb.  All of this food was high quality, reasonably priced and our server Jovanny was super friendly and attentive without being invasive.  Two drinks, an appetizer, shrimp fajitas for two, and the daddy bowl came to $77 after tax excluding tip.  I'd recommend this place to anyone and think if it had a location on the Strip, like where the not nearly as good Cabo Wabo is it'd be an hour wait for a table.

ZOdJzA_UCOh34b2hvqz3vQ.text: From the moment we walked into the door the experience was pleasant. The music was great, and the soft tacos were the best we have ever had. The nachos were amazing as well. It's a little pricy, but you get a ton of tasty food, so we were okay with that.

iq9c3VsMnkDDSdZ5yx6Fug.text: This place has good food. Nothing extraordinary. But I have it 5 stars for the service. Fast and helpful. I can't remember the waitresses name but she had dreadlock. She was super sweet and helped us with our menu.

xX4pvWAkl_jEM55vPLoOmg.text: Service from Johnathan our server sucked.  Personality of a Rock and mostly rude.   Now that being said, Daddys Margarita was very good and the nachos very good as well.  Did I mention our server not worth the 3 bucks I left him..
